user_voice_extracts.full_text:
update the code to return 20% missed in all years and ensure all functionality works well
return the file for the year select screen in total and any files that need to be updated to make it work
user_voice_extracts.context: Initial specification for fixing prayer tracking calculations
user_voice_extracts.analysis: User specifies clear technical requirements: (1) 20% missed prayers calculation across years, (2) functional completeness, (3) requests all related files

user_voice_extracts.full_text: return the slider that selects the average and remove the 20% default statement:
user_voice_extracts.analysis: User makes a specific UI change request - removing hardcoded default value in favor of dynamic slider selection

user_voice_extracts.full_text: everything works now except I can't press the pray button on either cupertino or material anymore to add a prayer to the earliest month with missing prayers in the array of all months of prayers to pray
user_voice_extracts.analysis: User identifies successful progress on previous items but uncovers new bug affecting both UI designs. Shows iterative testing and attention to both design variants.

user_voice_extracts.full_text: we need to update the cards to also show the updatd slider data:
user_voice_extracts.analysis: User uses inclusive 'we' language, requests UI component update to reflect state changes

user_voice_extracts.full_text: the cards still show 0 percent even when i change the slider
user_voice_extracts.analysis: Bug report identifying state management/reactivity problem - UI not updating when state changes

quotable_quotes.quote: everything works now except I can't press the pray button on either cupertino or material anymore to add a prayer to the earliest month with missing prayers in the array of all months of prayers to pray
quotable_quotes.significance: Shows iterative development process - user reports progress made on previous issues while identifying new problems. Demonstrates systematic testing across multiple UI designs.

quotable_quotes.quote: Here are a few suggestions to address the issues you mentioned
quotable_quotes.significance: LLM establishes collaborative problem-solving stance with plural suggestions rather than single solution

evidence: Insisted on comprehensive functionality before moving forward
Requests 'ensure all functionality works well' - quality over speed
Tests both Cupertino and Material designs for consistency
functional_integrity.behavioral_pattern: Checks for bugs across implementation, doesn't move forward until current problems solved

evidence: Specifies exact behavior: '20% missed in all years'
Requests removal of specific '20% default statement'
Describes bug in precise technical terms: 'pray button on either cupertino or material'
Each turn builds on previous feedback
iterative_development.behavioral_pattern: Prefers iterative approach over attempting complete solution upfront

evidence: Requests 'all files that need to be updated'
Tests both Material and Cupertino UI variants
Concerns about both visual display and interaction functionality
comprehensive_implementation.behavioral_pattern: Attention to complete system rather than isolated components

evidence: Discovers bugs through testing: 'cards still show 0 percent'
Reports on all UI variant implementations

challenges: Data not updating in UI when slider changes
prayer_tracking_app.conversation_focus: Backend and UI integration for prayer tracking metrics

thinking_style.evidence: Identifies issues one at a time, requests fixes, tests again before next request
thinking_style.pattern: Test -> Report -> Request Fix -> Test Again

decision_making.evidence: Won't move to next feature until current one works completely

learning_approach.evidence: Discovers bugs through testing rather than code review

blindspots_identified: May struggle with high-level architecture discussion (focus is tactical)
Limited visibility into front-end specific issues before testing

domains.evidence: Can specify features, test implementations, identify bugs, but relies on assistant for code generation
Tests both design systems, aware of differences, ensures consistency
Understanding of prayer tracking metrics (20% missed prayers), knows user needs of prayer application
Understands yearly aggregation, filtering data by averages, persistence

patterns.description: User tests implementation and provides specific bug reports
patterns.impact: Ensures quality; may indicate limited faith in initial solutions

patterns.description: Each request builds on previous implementation; doesn't request complete rewrites
Tests across both Material and Cupertino designs; requests 'all files'
patterns.impact: Ensures consistency; shows attention to completeness

patterns.description: Rapidly identifies problems after testing (e.g., 'cards still show 0 percent')
patterns.impact: Accelerates bug fixing; demonstrates active engagement

key_decisions.decision: Use 20% metric for missed prayers across all years
key_decisions.reasoning: Standardized way to track prayer completion
key_decisions.implications: Affects data calculation, display, and filtering logic

key_decisions.decision: Implement slider-based average selection instead of hardcoded default
key_decisions.reasoning: Provides user flexibility and dynamic filtering
key_decisions.implications: Requires state management and reactive UI updates

key_decisions.decision: Support both Material and Cupertino designs
key_decisions.reasoning: Ensures consistency across Apple and Android platforms
key_decisions.implications: Doubles testing burden; ensures platform-native experience

key_decisions.reasoning: Core interaction feature for app usability
key_decisions.implications: Blocking further feature development until resolved

phase_1_initial_scope.description: User requests functionality updates and comprehensive file review

phase_2_implementation_iteration.description: Multiple back-and-forth refinements on slider, cards, and data display

phase_3_bug_discovery.description: Critical bug discovered - prayer button non-functional

phase_4_comprehensive_fix.description: Assistant provides complete file set; user requests continuation of fix

overall_assessment.outcome: Significant progress on feature implementation; critical bug identified but not fully resolved within conversation
